text.p: Leading stories in the Greek financial press:
-- Unexpected pressure from oil prices. The U.S attack on Iraq sends oil prices higher. The rise of the dollar and oil prices affect inflation adversely
-- The Athends bourse is going to propose a draft law for the essential creation of a second parallel market with the Thessaloniki stock exchange as its centre
-- Inflationary pressures are being fed by the Gulf events. A small drop of inflation in August
-- The markets want autonomy from politics
-- Premier Simitis says the era of the state-protector is gone
-- Secret IMF report about the economy says it is on positive course and urges privatisations to proceed
-- The four private casinos had profits of 80 billion drachmas in the first eight months of 1996
-- The current account and inflation are causes for concern. The current account deficit in the first five months of this year is estimated to reach $2.0 billion

-- Greek industrialists are optimistic and forecast an increase of 34 percent in industrial production according to a EU survey conducted last March and April --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
